questions.question: What is zoology?
options: The study of animals and how they live
The study of stars and planets

questions.question: What are Biotic Factors?
options: Types of soil found in an ecosystem.
Living condition/thing that affects an ecosystem and the organisms within it.

questions.question: What are Abiotic Factors?
options: Non-living condition/thing that affects an ecosystem and the organisms in it.

questions.question: How do animals talk to each other?
options: They use sounds, body movements, and smells
They use their hands to make signs

questions.question: What happens when an animal blends into its environment?
options: It is using camouflage to hide from predators
It turns into a different animal

questions.question: Which animal below is a mammal?
What do baby animals need when they are born?
What do you think happens if animals donâ€™t find food or water?
options: They move to another place or may not survive
They buy food from a store
They grow wings and fly away

questions.question: Which of these is a way animals protect themselves?
What is a keystone species?
options: A species that has no natural predators.
A species that is found only in one particular habitat.
A species that is at the top of the food chain.
A species that other species in the ecosystem largely depend on.

questions.question: What do animals use their senses for?
options: To find food and stay safe

questions.question: Why do some animals have sharp teeth?
options: To help them eat their food

questions.question: What is one reason animals live in groups?
options: To work together and stay safe

questions.question: Which of these is a cold place where animals live?
Why do birds build nests?
options: To lay eggs and keep them safe

questions.question: What do scientists who study animals do?
options: Observe and learn about how animals live
